content.user_title: Scan web servers for vulnerabilities with Nikto
content.value_statement: Nikto is an open-source web server scanner that identifies dangerous files, outdated software versions, and server misconfigurations. Use this skill to conduct authorized security assessments and compliance scans against web servers and applications.
actual_capabilities: Scan web servers for known vulnerabilities and misconfigurations
Detect outdated server software and security patches
Generate reports in multiple formats (HTML, XML, CSV, TXT)
Apply evasion techniques for authorized testing
limitations: Cannot scan without explicit written authorization
Limited to web server-level vulnerabilities, not application logic
No native integration with CI/CD pipelines (manual setup required)

best_practices: Always obtain written authorization before scanning any system
Schedule scans during maintenance windows to minimize production impact
Document all findings with remediation steps for compliance reporting
anti_patterns: Running full scans on production systems during business hours
Ignoring false positive verification before reporting

faq.question: Is Nikto installed by default?
faq.answer: No. Nikto is a Perl-based tool that must be installed separately. Install via package manager (apt install nikto) or from source at cirt.net.

faq.question: What authorization do I need?
faq.answer: You need written authorization from the system owner that explicitly covers web server vulnerability scanning and specifies target scope.

faq.question: Does this skill run scans automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documentation and command templates. Users must run nikto commands directly after installing the tool.

faq.question: Is my scan data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: All scan results are saved locally to files you specify. No data is transmitted to external servers by this skill.

faq.question: Why does Nikto trigger so many alerts?
faq.answer: Nikto tests for thousands of known vulnerabilities and uses simple pattern matching, causing false positives. Always verify findings manually.

faq.question: How does Nikto compare to other scanners?
faq.answer: Nikto is fast and comprehensive for server-level issues but does not analyze application logic. Combine with tools like ZAP or Burp for complete coverage.
